detaileddescription.para: APP_HTTP_COMM_ISSUE_COUNT_FOR_RESET is an application logic count where-in upon encountering those many consecutive server communication failures the node will reset.
APP_POST_REQUEST_CUSTOM_HEADER_0 is a custom header which is sent along with the POST request.
APP_POST_REQUEST_CUSTOM_HEADER_1 is a custom header which is sent along with the POST request.

The maximum amount of data we download in a single request (in bytes). This number is limited by the platform abstraction layer implementation that ships with the XDK. The maximum value that will work here is 512 bytes.
Timeout for completion of HTTP rest client POST
Timeout for SNTP server time sync
APP_SENSORS_PAYLOAD_TO_BE_SERIALIZED is an application logic count which will define the number of sensor payloads to be serialized.
APP_SENSORS_TO_BE_SERIALIZED_PER_PAYLOAD is an application logic count which will define the number of sensors to be serialized per send.
Handle to store the main Command processor handle to be reused by ServalPAL thread
OS thread handle for Application controller
HTTP rest client configuration parameters
HTTP rest client POST parameters
HTTP rest client setup parameters
PPMP serializer setup parameters
Sensor setup parameters
SNTP setup parameters

memberdef.name: WLANSetupInfo
memberdef.initializer: = { .IsEnterprise = false, .IsHostPgmEnabled = false, .SSID = WLAN_SSID, .Username = WLAN_PSK, .Password = WLAN_PSK, .IsStatic = WLAN_STATIC_IP, .IpAddr = WLAN_IP_ADDR, .GwAddr = WLAN_GW_ADDR, .DnsAddr = WLAN_DNS_ADDR, .Mask = WLAN_MASK, }

detaileddescription.para: WLAN setup parameters

briefdescription.para: Gives control to the Application controller.

detaileddescription.para: This is a template function where the user can write his custom application.
Refer interface header for description

briefdescription.para: To enable the necessary modules for the application.
Responsible for controlling the PPMP Example application control flow.

listitem.para: Check whether the network connection is available
Synchronize the SNTP server for timestamp
Wait for APP_POST_INTERVAL_MS before proceeding to redoing the above steps

briefdescription.para: To setup the necessary modules for the application.
This will validate the WLAN network connectivity.

detaileddescription.para: Currently, upon abrupt disconnection the event from the WiFi chip is not propagated / notified to the application. Until then, we manually validate prior to ever HTTP Rest Client POST/GET cycle to make sure that the possibility of software break is reduced. We check if the IP is valid to validate the same.
If there is no connectivity we will restart the node after 10 seconds.
